meanings.sent1: The blindingly sun made me squint.
meanings.sent2: The stars were blindingly beautiful in the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The blindingly light reflected off the mirror and into my eyes.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was blindingly radiant, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The blindingly fireworks painted the sky with bursts of color.

meanings.definition: In a way that is extremely obvious or apparent
meanings.sent1: She blindingly pointed out the mistake on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The answer to the question was blindingly clear.
meanings.sent3: He blindingly wore mismatched socks to the party.
meanings.sent4: The truth was blindingly staring them in the face.
meanings.sent5: The blindingly obvious solution was right in front of them.

meanings.definition: In a way that is extremely fast or sudden
meanings.sent1: The car blindingly sped past us on the highway.
meanings.sent2: The news of the accident spread blindingly through the town.
meanings.sent3: He blindingly changed his mind about going to the concert.
meanings.sent4: The storm arrived blindingly, catching everyone off guard.
meanings.sent5: The blindingly quick decision surprised everyone in the room.
